creditline: The Walt McCarthy and Clara Ueland Endowment for Photographs
description: black and white image of a young girl standing in a doorway holding a carton of candy cigarettes; girl is wearing a floral dress and no shoes
text: This photograph shows a girl without shoes standing at her doorstep in a poor Southside Chicago neighborhood. Enrolled in the social documentary photography course taught by Aaron Siskind during his senior year at the Institute of Design in Chicago, Yasuhiro Ishimoto captured a moment when the wind slightly blew her skirt, remembering his influential teacher Harry Callahan’s advice of the importance of a photographer’s “willingness simply to let things happen.”
title: Untitled
